Articles.Content:
I don’t know if this happens to everyone.  Whenever I don’t play KSP for a few days I get stressed and find anyway to play it.  Does this happen to anyone else?

Edited December 6, 2017 by Rocketthrust

Oh God yes, glad I'm not the only one.

Even if I just load it up and fly a few of my favorite planes around or drive a silly rover for a few minutes...I just feel better.

More importantly though if I don't make some actual progress regularly I start to feel anxious and antsy.

Sometimes. Usually I'll play War Thunder or World Of Warships instead.  

Edited December 6, 2017 by Lo Var Lachland

We went away for a relaxing few days in September, nice little place a couple of pleasant eateries etc. I picked up the wrong laptop and spent the next few days edgier than a terminal nicotine addict on a long haul flight. It was the inability to play rather than the need to if you get my drift.

7 minutes ago, Lo Var Lachland said:

Yup. Sometimes. Usually I'll play War Thunder or World Of Warships instead. 

Eeek a fellow bote skipper. Which servers do you play on, i'll keep an eye out as I play on EU with a sideline of NA. IGN same as here.

Edited December 6, 2017 by dangerhamster

Though I'm the manager, I work at a very small business. So I have a lot to do. Most of my day is very mindless and repetitive. This is great for a natural daydreamer like myself. However, for the past year and a half, I spend most of that time thinking about rocket designs and upcoming missions. If it's not busy and the day drags I get irritable because I wanna try it right now. By the end of the day, I have a need so powerful only a true addict could understand. As a former smoker, it is definitely comparable to a day without a cigarette (an unbearable travesty). The funny thing is, the moment the game begins loading, I'm already feeling better. Very much like an addict who just scored. Just having it in your hand is a huge relief. Come to think of it, that's pretty messed up. They really should do a study on this. This can't be good for you.

2 hours ago, dangerhamster said:

Eeek a fellow bote skipper. Which servers do you play on, i'll keep an eye out as I play on EU with a sideline of NA. IGN same as here.

EU server for me.

2 hours ago, dangerhamster said:

We went away for a relaxing few days in September, nice little place a couple of pleasant eateries etc. I picked up the wrong laptop and spent the next few days edgier than a terminal nicotine addict on a long haul flight. It was the inability to play rather than the need to if you get my drift.

Eeek a fellow bote skipper. Which servers do you play on, i'll keep an eye out as I play on EU with a sideline of NA. IGN same as here.

NA. I play WoT more though.  I have a thread for WoT and WT Players. 

 

Edited December 6, 2017 by Lo Var Lachland
kerbal is like my point and click game to relax too
Usually KSP is a nice distraction from the little troubles of life. But at the moment Real Life hit the fan. No time to play or even worry about playing KSP.
What? I thought RL is a distraction from Kerbal.

Sometimes i do want to play KSP. But i don't get stressed from taking breaks.

Usually i start up the game without any idea of what i should do.

23 hours ago, NSEP said:

Sometimes i do want to play KSP. But i don't get stressed from taking breaks.

Usually i start up the game without any idea of what i should do.

Ive done that a lot... I usually would spend that session blowing up stuff in BDA... It is sooo fun!
